image.altText: A young girl with blonde hair in a ponytail wearing a blue basketball top stands on a basketball court with players behind her

props.synopsis: South Australian schools are signing deals with major sports clubs such as Manchester United and the Adelaide 36ers in a bid to attract students.

title.children: The battle for the sporting dollar: Adelaide schools signing deals with clubs to attract students

image.altText: A student at Yipirinya School wiping his eye.

props.synopsis: For decades, an eye disease known as trachoma was stealing the sight of Indigenous Australians. Now, the disease is on its way to being eradicated.

title.children: How this little-known eye infection is still stealing sight in parts of Australia

image.altText: A woman in sunglasses looking up at a man sitting below a statue.

props.synopsis: Families and advocates are hopeful positive changes will come from the more than 220 disability royal commission recommendations, but say impacted people must be at the heart of the response. WARNING: This story contains images that may distress some readers.

title.children: 'Consultation isn't enough': South Australian advocates want 'disability-led' response to royal commission recommendations

image.altText: a house for sale in the brisbane suburb of stafford with the sale sign in the front yard

props.synopsis: Housing data for September shows prices rose 0.8 per cent, led by Adelaide, Brisbane and Perth, despite a gradual increase in properties for sale and higher interest rates.

title.children: House prices on track to hit new record high, continuing to frustrate first homebuyers

image.altText: A firefighter in front of a room on fire.

props.synopsis: The fire broke out in the early hours of Sunday in adjoining nightclubs in Atalayas, on the outskirts of the city Murcia in south-east Spain.

title.children: At least 13 dead in Spanish nightclub fire as families search for missing people

image.altText: An aerial photo of a small, busy town at sunset with a hotel in the foreground and cars parked along the main street.

props.synopsis: Converted airports, refurbished nursing homes, caravans, sheds and school camps aren't considered suitable housing options. But they're all in the mix as workers struggle to find a place to live near their workplace that they can afford.

title.children: This seaside town is so popular that employers are turning an aged care home into accommodation for their staff

image.altText: Nathan Cleary

props.synopsis: Brisbane had Penrith dead to rights with 20 minutes left in the grand final but they gave Nathan Cleary just enough time to cement his legend.

title.children: Nathan Cleary's NRL grand final performance cements his place alongside modern greats

image.altText: A Brisbane Broncos NRL player scores a try in the grand final.

props.synopsis: Penrith launches a comeback for the ages to earn legendary status, Brisbane is made to pay for botched drop-outs, while Ezra Mam lights up the grand final. These are the five quick hits from Penrith's third consecutive premiership triumph.

title.children: NRL grand final five quick hits: Costly kicking errors crush Broncos despite Mam magic

image.altText: An artist's drawing of a hospital building site

props.synopsis: An independent financial watchdog wants laws changed so they can have better access to SA cabinet submissions, amid concerns approvals for billions of dollars in government spending can't be reviewed. State political reporter Rory McClaren explains.

title.children: SA auditor-general wants better access to cabinet submissions to scrutinise projects. Will he get his way?

image.altText: Rebecca Jeffcoat wearing goggles and sub-zero protective clothing in Antarctic landscape.

props.synopsis: It's one of the most challenging work environments on the planet. But with hundreds of applicants, the process of selecting the best candidate takes eight months and resembles a reality TV contest.

title.children: Reckon you can handle a year in Antarctica as a station leader? This is what it takes to pass the test

image.altText: A white bus with the words City Bus on the front next to a paved footpath

props.synopsis: The Mount Gambier council, people with disabilities and those living on the city's outskirts had hoped for an improved bus service but a new contract is set to keep it the same for another eight years.

title.children: SA's second-largest city to keep 'inadequate' bus system after 30 years without change

image.altText: A composite image of pancakes with strawberries and cream, and Trevor Braun holding strawberries and cream with chocolate sauce.

props.synopsis: Trevor Braun was struggling to feed his family during a devastating drought, so he decided to sell the family farm to focus on selling sweet treats.

title.children: Farmers walk away from drought, distress to celebrate sweet food van success

image.altText: Fraser McReight dives over

props.synopsis: The Wallabies conceded the first try and had two players sent to the sin bin, but still managed to keep their faint Rugby World Cup hopes alive with a victory over Portugal — now they need Os Lobos to do them a huge favour.

title.children: Five quick hits — a shock Portugal lead and the Wallabies hold firm with 13 men to stay alive at the World Cup

image.altText: Angus Bell is hugged

props.synopsis: The Wallabies are still an outside chance of qualifying for the Rugby World Cup quarterfinals, recording a bonus point win against a brave Portuguese side despite being reduced to 13 men during the second half.

title.children: Wallabies beat Portugal to stay alive at the Rugby World Cup

image.altText: A video screen grab of an explosion on the side of a street.

props.synopsis: The attack comes just hours before the scheduled reopening of parliament following a summer recess.

title.children: Suicide bomber detonates explosive in Turkish capital, second assailant killed in shootout

image.altText: Scene of car crash with investigators under a tent near a crashed truck and car near bush on side of road

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Police have confirmed six people died in a head-on crash involving a road train and four-wheel drive on the Stuart Highway.

title.children: Six people killed in Northern Territory's deadliest road crash in 16 years, police say

image.altText: Queensland police badge says "with honour we serve"

props.synopsis: Police will allege the 74-year-old victim was thrown from the first-floor balcony of a unit in Yeronga, striking the cement below and sustaining serious head injuries.

title.children: Man charged with murder after elderly man allegedly thrown from balcony in Brisbane suburb

image.altText: Elise Archer rests her head on her hand in parliament.

props.synopsis: Former Tasmanian Liberal MP Elise Archer says she's "reconsidering" quitting state parliament and might sit as an Independent, which an electoral analyst says could trigger an early state election.

title.children: Elise Archer 'reconsidering' quitting parliament, early election risk for Tasmanian Liberals

image.altText: Reddish-coloured smoke from a bushfire with flat cultivated ground in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Three major bushfires are burning out of control in eastern Victoria, as thousands of campers who took to the bush for the long weekend pack up and flee.

title.children: Three out of control bushfires have residents and campers fleeing parts of Gippsland

image.altText: Large crowd at music festival

props.synopsis: Two men in their 20s have died after attending the Knockout Outdoor festival, while nine urgent medical transfers were made from Listen Out festival at Centennial Park.

title.children: 'It's horrible': Two people dead after attending Knockout Outdoor music festival in Sydney

image.altText: Two people sharing a cup of tea at a table.

props.synopsis: The central Victorian community of Heathcote has become a hub of dementia innovation, driven by passionate volunteers and the local hospital.

title.children: A small community helping people with dementia has created a house that's 'almost like another carer'

props.synopsis: Local residents say they heard the sound of a whale crying out early Sunday morning before a calf was released from a shark net.

title.children: Sound of trapped humpback whale calf heard across Sunshine Coast suburb before rescue

image.altText: A crocodile and a Chinook helicopter.

props.synopsis: Crocs at a Rockhampton reptile farm were flung into the throes of orgiastic ecstasy after a Chinook helicopter hovered low over their pools – and the erotic explosion has researchers very interested.

title.children: Croc sex frenzy: Low-flying army choppers spark romp in the swamp

image.altText: Colourful pencils on a desk in a childcare centre.

props.synopsis: Australian parents facing crippling cost-of-living pressures are paying almost twice the OECD average for child care, an ACCC inquiry finds, with the system also failing to deliver for low-income families and those in the bush.

title.children: Australia's for-profit childcare system favours the wealthy and needs a major re-design: ACCC

image.altText: Dakota Davidson

props.synopsis: Brisbane Lions AFLW coach Craig Starcevich says a slow start against the Hawks was the wake-up call the team needed before cruising to victory.

title.children: 'Good old fashioned kick up the backside': Lions bounce back after slow start as Roos keep Giants goalless

image.altText: A young man in a suit with a microphone in front of a red curtain.

props.synopsis: In his daily life, Tahj Burns is quiet. But when singing to an audience, his shyness melts away and his confidence and charisma shine.

title.children: Tahj's family had no idea he could sing. When they heard his voice on stage, they were stunned

image.altText: Police tape

props.synopsis: Police were called to the scene on a dirt track in bushland just before 4pm.

title.children: Six teenagers believed to be involved in ute rollover near Kalgoorlie in WA, one critical

image.altText: Bandidos members and their bikes in Burnie, northern Tasmania, November 2017.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police say a senior member of the Bandidos motorcycle gang presented to a Ballarat hospital with a gunshot wound. The gang is in Ballarat for its national run.

title.children: Member of notorious motorcycle gang shot during bikie run in Ballarat

image.altText: A man in green clothes on the left shakes hands with a man in a blue suit on the right

props.synopsis: Defence Secretary Grant Shapps tells British media there was scope to offer military training within Ukraine.

title.children: UK aims to offer military training inside Ukraine, defence secretary says

image.altText: Jordie van den Berg leaning against a red brick wall smiling at his phone.

props.synopsis: Jordie van den Berg, a 27-year-old trained lawyer, is working to turn the tables on landlords and real estate agents with a website featuring more 1,500 reviews of rental properties and owners.

title.children: Black mould and exposed asbestos: Meet the TikToker giving a voice to renters

image.altText: A young white woman in a wheelchair out on the street

props.synopsis: The role of special schools is again in the spotlight, with the disability royal commission recommending segregated education be phased out.

title.children: Australia has long been divided on 'special schools'. Now the disability royal commission is too

props.synopsis: Irish band U2 christen the stage of the new $3.4 billion spherical stage structure dubbed the "future of music" in Las Vegas, Nevada.

title.children: Las Vegas Sphere hosts first concert, putting on spectacle for U2 fans
